questions.question_text:
Static addressing was replaced with dynamic addressing during network maintenance. Following the maintenance, multiple users began reporting connectivity issues. A technician sees the following when checking the address assignments on a user's workstation:

IP address 169.254.1.2 -
The technician attempts to run commands that will force the PC to request a new IP address, but the technician receives the same address. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

choices.A: Run the command ipconfig/flushdns to force the PC to use the DNS server for its next request.
choices.B: Switch the PC to the wireless network to get the users back to work.
choices.D: Check the DHCP server to ensure the scope is large enough for all users.
choices.C: Replace the network cable from the PC to the wall jack.

discussion.content: Any IP starting with 169.254 is an APIPA address or "Link local" so this tells us something is wrong with the DHCP.

questions.question_text: Which of the following cloud computing concepts is used to describe online providers that serve multiple clients with scalable services, such as access to a large number of CPUs and memory from multiple sources?

comments.content: Keywords are "serve multiple clients" and thats why it's resource pooling. Rapid elasticity just describes being able to scale cloud resources, it doesn't make mention of serving those resources in a multi-tenant environment. At least that's my understanding.

questions.question_text: When a user types on a laptop, the cursor randomly moves around and clicks elsewhere in the document, causing the user to have to edit and retype portions of the document. Which of the following should the technician disable to resolve the issue?
Which of the following is a common use for NAT?

choices.B: Hiding the network portion of an IPv4 address
choices.C: Connecting multiple devices through a single public IP address

discussion.content:
From Messer's notes
"It is estimated that there are over 20 billion devices
connected to the Internet (and growing)
• IPv4 supports around 4.29 billion addresses
• The address space for IPv4 is exhausted
• There are no available addresses to assign
• How does it all work?
• Network Address Translation
• This isn’t the only use of NAT
• NAT is handy in many situations

Still stupid wording of the question

comments.content: just like what you described, NAT is for translating multiple local IP addresses to your public IP. They are stating multiple devices as each device will have an IP address in your network.

discussion.content: NAT is for multiple ip adress to single ip adress. So how come its c.the answer?

questions.question_text: A technician installed a new printer for a client and successfully printed a test page. The next day, the customer reports there are garbled characters on printed pages. The technician questions the user and discovers OS updates were applied overnight. Which of the following should the technician check NEXT to troubleshoot the issue?

choices.C: If the printer's onboard memory is low
choices.B: If the correct printer driver is selected
choices.D: If the Windows Print Spooler service is running
choices.A: If the device appears in the Device Manager
